occurrences.text: he's saying, I'm an eyewitness. Remember as we started this book, we talked about how he says we've heard Him, we've seen Him, we've handled Him. He's providing this truth, and he says, listen, there are many false teachers. They are anti-Christ. They're against the Lord Jesus Christ. They deny that He is God, and in their denial of Him being God, they do not have the Father. 2 John 1, there's only one chapter, but 2 John and verse number 7, the Bible says this. Notice just a few pages over in 2 John, verse number 7, for many deceivers are entered into the world. Do you see how every one of these references talks about the plurality of them and the number of them? There are many, and it says this, who confess not that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh. This is a deceiver and an anti-Christ. Jesus did come in the flesh. He was born of a virgin. He was born. Remember, you think about the truth of Philippians chapter number 2, where the Bible talks about, let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus, and you begin to read the truth of Philippians 2, and you read about the incarnation, and you read about all that takes place, and what a blessing to see the summary that is given. It continues and says, who being in
